title: Satellite-to-ground quantum-limited communication using a 50-kg-class microsatellite
title_cn: 使用50公斤级微卫星的卫星对地面量子受限通信
abstract: The recent rapid growth of satellite-constellation programmes for remote sensing and communications, enabled by the availability of small-sized and low-cost satellites, has provided impetus for the development of high-capacity laser communication (lasercom) in space. Quantum-limited communication can enhance the performance of lasercom and is also a prerequisite for the intrinsically hack-proof secure communication known as quantum key distribution. Here, we report a quantum-limited communication experiment between a microsatellite (48 kg, 50 cm cube) in low Earth orbit and a ground station. Non-orthogonal polarization states were transmitted from the satellite at a 10 MHz repetition rate. On the ground, by post-processing the received quantum states with ∼0.146 photons per pulse, clock data recovery and polarization reference-frame synchronization were successfully achieved, even under remarkable Doppler shifts. The quantum states were discriminated by a receiver with four photon counters, with a quantum bit error rate below 5%, validating the applicability of our technology to satellite-to-ground lasercom and quantum key distribution.
abstract_cn: 由于小型和低成本卫星的出现，近来用于遥感和通信的卫星星座计划迅速增长，这为空间高容量激光通信（lasercom）的发展提供了动力。量子受限的通信可以提高lasercom的性能，这也是称为量子密钥分发的本质上防黑客攻击的安全通信的先决条件。在这里，我们报告了低地球轨道上的微卫星（48千克，50立方厘米）和地面站之间的量子受限通信实验。非正交极化状态是从卫星以10＆＃8197MHz的重复速率发送的。在地面上，即使在显着的多普勒频移下，通过以每脉冲0.146个光子对接收到的量子态进行后处理，也可以成功实现时钟数据恢复和偏振参考帧同步。带有四个光子计数器的接收器区分了量子态，量子误码率低于5％，这验证了我们的技术在卫星对地面激光通信和量子密钥分配中的适用性。

title: Long-distance free-space quantum key distribution in daylight towards inter-satellite communication
title_cn: 朝着星际通信的远距离自由空间量子密钥分配
abstract: In the past, long-distance free-space quantum communication experiments could only be implemented at night. During the daytime, the bright background sunlight prohibits quantum communication in transmission under conditions of high channel loss over long distances. Here, by choosing a working wavelength of 1,550 nm and developing free-space single-mode fibre-coupling technology and ultralow-noise upconversion single-photon detectors, we have overcome the noise due to sunlight and demonstrate free-space quantum key distribution over 53 km during the day. The total channel loss is ∼48 dB, which is greater than the 40 dB channel loss between the satellite and ground and between low-Earth-orbit satellites. Our system thus demonstrates the feasibility of satellite-based quantum communication in daylight. Moreover, given that our working wavelength is located in the optical telecom band, our system is naturally compatible with ground fibre networks and thus represents an essential step towards a satellite-constellation-based global quantum network.
abstract_cn: 过去，长距离自由空间量子通信实验只能在晚上进行。在白天，在远距离高信道损耗的情况下，明亮的背景太阳光会阻止传输中的量子通信。在这里，通过选择工作波长为1,550＆＃8197; nm并开发自由空间单模光纤耦合技术和超低噪声上转换单光子检测器，我们克服了阳光造成的噪声并展示了自由空间量子白天的密钥分布超过53＆＃8197;公里。总信道损耗为＆＃8764; 48＆＃8197; dB，大于卫星与地面之间以及低地球轨道卫星之间的40＆＃8197; dB信道损耗。我们的系统因此证明了在白天进行基于卫星的量子通信的可行性。此外，由于我们的工作波长位于光通信频段内，因此我们的系统与地面光纤网络自然兼容，因此代表了朝着基于卫星星座的全球量子网络迈出的重要一步。

title: High-order multiphoton Thomson scattering
title_cn: 高阶多光子汤姆逊散射
abstract: Electron–photon scattering, or Thomson scattering, is one of the most fundamental mechanisms in electrodynamics, underlying laboratory and astrophysical sources of high-energy X-rays. After a century of studies, it is only recently that sufficiently high electromagnetic field strengths have been available to experimentally study the nonlinear regime of Thomson scattering in the laboratory. Making use of a high-power laser and a laser-driven electron accelerator, we made the first measurements of high-order multiphoton scattering, in which more than 500 near-infrared laser photons were scattered by a single electron into a single X-ray photon. Both the electron motion and the scattered photons were found to depend nonlinearly on field strength. The observed angular distribution of scattered X-rays permits independent measurement of absolute intensity, in situ, during interactions of ultra-intense laser light with free electrons. Furthermore, the experiment's potential to generate attosecond-duration hard X-ray pulses can enable the study of ultrafast nuclear dynamics.
abstract_cn: 电子光子散射或Thomson散射是电动力学，基础实验室和高能X射线天体物理学的最基本机制之一。经过一个世纪的研究，直到最近，才有足够高的电磁场强度可用于在实验室中对汤姆逊散射的非线性机制进行实验研究。利用大功率激光和激光驱动的电子加速器，我们首次进行了高阶多光子散射的测量，其中，单个电子将500多个近红外激光光子散射到单个X射线中光子发现电子运动和散射光子都非线性地依赖于场强。观察到的散射X射线的角度分布允许在超强激光与自由电子相互作用期间原位独立地测量绝对强度。此外，该实验具有产生亚秒级硬X射线脉冲的潜力，可以研究超快核动力学。

title: Phonon scattering inhibits simultaneous near-unity efficiency and indistinguishability in semiconductor single-photon sources
title_cn: 声子散射抑制了半导体单光子源中同时的近统一效率和可分辨性
abstract: Semiconductor quantum dots (QDs) have recently emerged as a leading platform to generate highly indistinguishable photons efficiently, and this work addresses the timely question of how good these solid-state sources can ultimately be. We establish the crucial role of lattice relaxation in these systems in giving rise to trade-offs between indistinguishability and efficiency. We analyse the two source architectures most commonly employed: a QD embedded in a waveguide and a QD coupled to an optical cavity. For waveguides, we demonstrate that the broadband Purcell effect results in a simple inverse relationship, in which indistinguishability and efficiency cannot be simultaneously increased. For cavities, the frequency selectivity of the Purcell enhancement results in a more subtle trade-off, in which indistinguishability and efficiency can be increased simultaneously, although not arbitrarily, which limits a source with near-unity indistinguishability (>99%) to an efficiency of approximately 96% for realistic parameters.
abstract_cn: 半导体量子点（QD）最近成为一种有效地产生高度不可区分的光子的领先平台，这项工作解决了这些固态光源最终的优良性能的及时问题。我们在这些系统中建立了晶格弛豫的关键作用，以在不可分辨性和效率之间进行权衡。我们分析了两种最常用的源架构：嵌入在波导中的QD和耦合到光学腔的QD。对于波导，我们证明宽带赛尔效应产生简单的逆关系，其中不可分辨性和效率无法同时提高。对于腔体而言，珀塞尔增强的频率选择性会导致更微妙的权衡，其中可分辨性和效率可同时（尽管不是任意地）提高，这将具有近统一不可分辨性（> 99％）的源限制为实际参数的效率约为96％。
